extracted_data_phrases: by failing to respect their authority

disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Have I skipped any prescribed days of fasting, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I speak words that belittled the Church?

lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

lust.question: Did I see others primarily in terms of what they could offer me, such as companionship, assistance, or emotional support, rather than valuing their inherent dignity and humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, thinking they were solely due to my own efforts rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I ever felt jealous of others' blessings, perhaps thinking they shouldn't have them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished others would struggle in areas where they excel, perhaps feeling envious of their success?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly envied others' successes and felt unhappy for them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

about my favorite hobbies , interests , or experiences
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language when engaging in conversations about my favorite hobbies, interests, or experiences?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: with words that were coarse or unbecoming
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your conversations, speaking to others with words that were coarse or unbecoming?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during times of leisure such as travel or social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, perhaps during social gatherings or when trying new foods?

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to enjoying meals with friends and family at social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized recreational activities over meeting my financial responsibilities, potentially straining my ability to provide for family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' shortcomings or private matters
gossip.question: Have I indulged in discussing others' shortcomings or private matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: at the expense of sharing others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I ever entertained myself at the expense of sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I cause unnecessary hardship to others by my actions on Sundays when rest was otherwise available?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
